stem: The nurse is caring for a client who is one day post-operative following a lumbar laminectomy. Which of the following nursing actions are essential for this client's care? Select all that apply.

options.text: Encourage the client to twist at the waist.
Encourage deep breathing and coughing exercises.
Elevate the head of the bed to 90 degrees.

rationale.correct: Maintaining proper body alignment prevents complications and promotes healing. Logrolling maintains spinal alignment during turning. Assessing pain helps manage discomfort and promote mobility. Monitoring for CSF leakage is crucial to detect complications early. Encouraging deep breathing and coughing prevents respiratory complications.
rationale.mnemonic: LAMB: Logroll, Assess pain, Monitor CSF, Breathe deeply
rationale.incorrect: Encouraging the client to twist at the waist can disrupt spinal alignment and impede healing. Administering a full liquid diet is not specific to post-laminectomy care. Elevating the head of the bed to 90 degrees can increase pressure on the surgical site.
rationale.questionTrap: The question requires the nurse to identify essential actions, not just any action that might be performed.
clinicalPearls: Post-laminectomy care focuses on maintaining spinal alignment, managing pain, and preventing complications.
Logrolling is a technique used to turn patients while maintaining spinal alignment.

itemContext.sbar: John Smith is a 55-year-old male, one day post-operative lumbar laminectomy. He reports pain at the surgical site and difficulty with mobility.
